https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/over-3-million-paid-individuals-disability-settlement-greyhound

Description: To resolve multistate litigation relating to the anticompetitive impacts of its acquisition of Laidlaw Educational Services, First Group agreed not to enforce non-competition contracts which would prevent departing employees from starting new school bus transportation companies that would compete with the merged company. It also agreed to give notice of any future acquisitions during the next six years and pay $1.1 million to be divided among the participating states to defray legal fees.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/brown-reaches-antitrust-agreement-nations-largest-school-bus-operators

Description: First Student Inc. agreed to pay $450,000 in settlement of allegations it violated an order prohibiting bus idling outside schools and in its facilities, and failed to submit required compliance reports.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20140422224801/http://www.mass.gov/ago/news-and-updates/press-releases/2014/2014-03-05-first-student-settlement.html

Description: First Transit agreed to pay $7.3 million to settle allegations that it violated the Consumer Protection Act when it backed out of a contract with the MBTA to run a paratransit service that provided door-to-door transportation to individuals who are unable to use the general public transportation systems because of disabilities.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20121222102225/http://www.mass.gov/ago/news-and-updates/press-releases/2012/2012-11-02-first-transit.html
https://www.nj.gov/oag/newsreleases07/pr20070926a.html

Description: The New York Attorney General reached agreement with six companies to reduce air pollution caused by idling trucks and buses. As part of the settlement the firms agreeed to pay a total of $110,343. The announcement did not specify how the payment would be divided among the companies. Here we assume it was split evenly among them.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20101116003528/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2002/jun/jun18a_02.html

Description: Laidlaw Transit was cited for failing to pay the minimum state wage to 332 school bus drivers.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20060924204730/http://www.ago.state.ma.us/sp.cfm?pageid=986&id=1659
https://web.archive.org/web/20021116152336/http://www.ago.state.ma.us/press_rel/schoolbus.asp

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 485999: All Other Transit and Ground Passenger Transportation
Info Source: February 7, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: Extracted from a spreadsheet obtained from the NLRB through a Freedom of Information Act request fulfilled on 5/28/2020.

Description: Greyhound agreed to pay $2.2 million in settlement of allegations  it allowed immigration agents to board its buses and conduct immigration sweeps without warrants or reasonable suspicion, misrepresented its role in allowing the sweeps to occur and subjected its passengers to discrimination based on race, skin color or national origin.
Info Source: https://www.atg.wa.gov/news/news-releases/greyhound-must-stop-allowing-warrantless-and-suspicionless-immigration-sweeps-pay

Description: The Washington Utilities and Transportation Commission assessed a $23,700 penalty against First Student, Inc. for violations of Washington Administrative Code (WAC) 480-30-221, which adopts by reference sections of Title 49 Code of Federal Regulations (C.F.R.).
Info Source: https://www.utc.wa.gov/casedocket/2019/190152/docsets
